column4: Can someone help me? I have a tripple boot system, windows XP, Mac and Ubuntnu, and want to access my music files in Ubuntu. Any ideas?
My music folder in my username's folder
how did you get Windows on there boot camp?
When I am in ubuntnu, it won't allow access
is Windows on a NTFS partition?
I'm in mac now, Will it still work?
well on PC's anyway with Ubuntu Hardy Heron.  there is a built in driver for Windows that is on a NTFS.  and  files can as a result easily be moved/copyed into Ubuntu
bootcamp hummm do you know about Mac virtualmachine software?
I want them to remain where they are, because I can access all mac files, except my username protects them from accessing them
: Yea, I prefer trippleboot because I can still use them as virtual machines too
Yea. I see the linux and XP
oh right using a psyical install as a VM?
